alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 6:29PM EDT until August 07 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR WESTERN FAIRFIELD...SOUTHEASTERN NEWBERRY AND SALUDA COUNTIES... At 628 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Monticello to near Saluda, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. Multiple trees down across Newberry county including trees down on I-26. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Newberry, Batesburg- Leesville, VC Summer Nuclear Station, Saluda, Prosperity, Ridge Spring, Jenkinsville, Saluda County Airport, Monticello, Dreher Island State Park, Blair, Little Mountain, Monetta, Pomaria, Silverstreet, Ward, Peak, Lebanon Fire Station, Saluda Co Sheriff`s Office, and US-176 and SC-34 Crossroads. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 75 and 89. Interstate 77 near mile marker 51. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
